result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
*Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

*Sign releases of information for service coordination as directed 
*Continue with current mental health treatment programming 
*Participate in any community  based services as recommended by the VIP Program Director 
*If sucessfully completes the VIP Program then Count 1 will be dismissed

timeConds.notes: *At least 15 hours of community service is to be with the Portage County Parks Department

judgments.dispoDesc:
*Dismissed with Prejudice
*Defendant has complied with all requirements of the VIP

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas R Ambrosius

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas R Ambrosius in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:31 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Atty Cousins provides the Court with a copy of the VIP Program recommendations.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court does not find the defendant guilty on Count 1 due to his acceptance into the VIP Program and Counts 2 & 3 are DRI.  Clerk directed to withhold entry of Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Redfield makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Placed in the VIP Program for 9 months
25 hrs of community service with at least 15 hours with the Portage County Parks Dept.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Do not possess drug paraphernalia 
Sign releases of information for service coordination as directed 
Continue with current mental health treatment programming 
Participate in any community based services as recommended by the VIP Program Director
If successfully completes the VIP Program then Count 1 will be dismissed.

Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 20, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 16, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 19, 2016 at 10:15 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on May 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Court finds probable cause for the three counts.
P/NG entered
State requests a $350 cash bond with conditions requested to remain on file.
BTC: $350 cash bond remains.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.
